snippet.textDisplay: As an abuse victim, I came out of a haze of uncertainty & reached clarity as to what was happening. I took out a restraining order & never spoke to my abuser again. Let alone meet the man I’m afraid of. He continues to stalk me but that’s a long story. Before then I would go back & forth to him for 2yrs but I was still in that fog of “is it really happening” sure id called the police a number of times in highly abusive moments but always dropped supporting a prosecution as I was still not at a point of clarity, I was still living with my manipulator/abuser but by the time I left him & took out a restraining order, I was very very sure as to what had happened, he was an abuser & it/he won’t change. You have reached a certain amount of clarity, reality has broken through for you to reach the step in which you take an order out, you are no longer living in the abuse, in the daily manipulation. So why would Amber then meet Depp? Also it wasn’t like Depp was coercing and harassing Amber into meeting in San Fran. I could understand the meet more if any of that was present but as far as I’m aware, Amber took those steps to meet him? It is impossible to fully psychologically recover from abuse so it’s surprising to me you’d go public with all the allegations shortly after the relationship ended, it’s hard to process, to take the step to even talking to a singular person about an abusive relationship. It took me a very long time, I’ve been a recluse 5yrs no social media etc & I was once v sociable. I still don’t talk to anyone I know/knew. After 5yrs of not being with my abuser. I still can’t come out with it openly as myself. I’m an anxious ghost of the person I once was. So for a victim to come out so boldly knowing the whole world will be watching is quite alien to me. Yes, we are all different. But I could not imagine the fear a victim would have taking on a worldly celebrity with these allegations, her deposition did not seem authentic it felt acted. Ive been through the stuff that Amber is claiming & when asked questions, my answers all come splurging out in a jumbled mess of articulated emotion with physical symptoms of stress being uncontrollable. I hate to say this, but in my opinion & I’m not claiming my opinion to be factual but I can’t believe Amber Heard, her deposition seemed so calm, calculated. The way she was eating to give herself time to think of answers to questions was odd. Something felt very off. I believe Johnny is the victim of domestic abuse here. That video that surfaced of him, yes he was slamming doors & yes abusers do that but normal people also do that in times of extreme stress & frustration. If I was settled with 7million. I would get some therapy move away & move on. Its us women down here without the financial resources & power are the ones that need change towards domestic abuse & I’m not diminishing the fact that famous women do go through these horrible abusive relationships but they have a lot of options open to them to further their healing & that’s what it should be about, healing. Defecating in his bed? I mean gender reverse that, if a man defecated in a woman’s bed it would most likely be brandished a form of abuse to add to the pattern of abuse. Sh**** in somebodies bed to me can not be considered a “harmless prank” Victims do anything to avoid escalating abuse. Everything & anything you do will be used against you. Abusers do nasty things & love to brandish it a joke. So she allegedly suffered all of this abuse, yet had the fearless gumption to take a dump in her abusers bed? Also separately, the Marilyn Manson situation. I can not comment at all. I’ve been a die hard fan since I was a child, it’d be totally biased. But just to add my abuser did not have any prior relationships that were abuse free. So it’s a conundrum that Marilyn & Ditas 7yr relationship included no abuse. Can abusers change according to who they are with, I don’t know but most commonly not. Apologies for the long essay.✌️&💕

snippet.textDisplay: Okay  I will fill you in about the restraining orders and hopefully this will help everyone to understand anyone can file a restaining order against anyone and here is what gets a lot of people mixed up if I file a restraining order against you and I can plainly see you are at McDonald's this is only for example but I see you at McDonald's and I walk in I do not have to leave you would have to leave. If I was to walk into your home you would have to leave. An if you stayed there it would not be me to get into trouble it would be you. As the restraining order is against you. However I believe that needs to be changed. I believe if a person files a restraining order against someone that both parties should get into trouble if they are seen around each other. Just as when she used a friend to contact Johnny he could of got into some serious trouble for allowing a third party contact. What Johnny should of done as soon as his friend tried to make contact on AH behalf was to tell his friend please do not write, text, or call me on her belalf.

snippet.textDisplay: The melodramatic show, i think,can be seen in her presence in interviews etc. She's all neutral and emotionless (just enjoying the cameras, you could also assume). And then she pushes the show-button on: all the angry "crying" blah  blah.. which, what you feel and see clearly is a show (and, as someone said: not even a one of a skilled acctress, but a bad one [in both of it's meanings] )
